title: Fell off the Segway
text: This afternoon I had a little mishap and fell off my Segway. Thankfully, I'm okay! Just a few scrapes and bruises. It was a reminder to always wear protective gear and stay cautious while riding.

title: Recommendation Algorithms Workshop
text: I've been working on the recommendation algorithm workshop for RhythmHacks 2025. Check out more here: https://github.com/adamstirtan/rhythmhacks2025

title: Building with D3.js
text:
# Building with D3.js

D3.js is an amazing library for creating interactive data visualizations. In this post, I explore how to build force-directed graphs.

```javascript
const simulation = d3.forceSimulation(nodes)
    .force("link", d3.forceLink(links))
    .force("charge", d3.forceManyBody())
    .force("center", d3.forceCenter());
```

The key is understanding how forces interact to create the layout.

title: Web Dev Best Practices
text:
# Web Development Best Practices

Some key principles I follow:

1. **Performance First** - Optimize for speed
2. **Accessibility** - Make it usable for everyone
3. **Responsive Design** - Works on all devices
4. **Clean Code** - Maintainable and readable

These principles guide all my web projects.

title: Power of Visualization
text:
# The Power of Visualization

Data visualization transforms complex information into understandable insights. Whether it's a simple chart or an interactive graph, visualization helps us see patterns and relationships.

> "The purpose of visualization is insight, not pictures." - Ben Shneiderman

This quote perfectly captures what I aim for in my visualization work.

title: JS Tips & Tricks
text:
# JavaScript Tips and Tricks

Here are some useful JavaScript patterns I use frequently:

- Destructuring for cleaner code
- Arrow functions for concise syntax
- Async/await for better promise handling
- Template literals for string formatting

These features make modern JavaScript development much more enjoyable.
